title: Empathy Map
description: Empathy maps help teams better understand their users by visualizing their thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.

title: Persona
description: Personas are fictional characters that represent the different user types that might use your product or service.

title: User Journey Map
description: User journey maps help teams visualize the steps that users take when interacting with a product or service.

title: Mind Map
description: Mind maps are diagrams that help teams visualize ideas and concepts and how they relate to each other.

title: SWOT Analysis
description: SWOT analysis is a framework for analyzing the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats of a product or service.

title: Storyboard
description: Storyboards are visual representations of a product or service that help teams understand how users will interact with it.

title: Prototyping
description: Prototyping is the process of creating a preliminary version of a product or service to test and refine its design.

title: User Testing
description: User testing is the process of observing users as they interact with a product or service to identify usability issues and areas for improvement.

title: Design Sprint
description: Design sprints are a five-day process for solving design problems and testing new ideas.
